articles.content:
Clone rabbits made 
    Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- The Institute of Experimental Biology under the Academy of Sciences of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea has succeeded in rabbit cloning.
 Researchers of the institute made two rabbits (male) in July last year by developing a somatic cell cloning technology based on fibroblast derived from 15-day-old fetus.    
 The one-year observation of these rabbits proved that they had fertility.
 The rabbits have already produced tens of leverets.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam greets Mozambican President
Greetings to Mongolian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam greets Mozambican President
    Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Joaquim Alberto Chissano, President of Mozambique, on July 10.
 The message warmly congratulated the president on the successful opening of the second summit of heads of state and government of the African Union and his assumption of its chairmanship, noting that the summit marked a significant occasion of making new progress in achieving the unity and prosperity of Africa.    
 It sincerely hoped that he as chairman of the union would achieve signal success in his responsible work for strengthening it and for the unity and cooperation among the African countries and the peace, stability and development of the continent including Mozambique.

articles.title: Greetings to summit of heads of state and government of African Union
articles.content:
Greetings to Mongolian President
    Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today sent a message of greetings to Natsagiin Bagabandi, President of Mongolia, on the occasion of the 82nd anniversary of the victory of the people's revolution in Mongolia.
 The message wished the president and the people of Mongolia greater success in their work, and expressed the belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger in the interests of the two peoples.

articles.title: Hong Song Nam greets Peruvian Prime Minister
articles.content:
Greetings to summit of heads of state and government of African Union
    Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, today sent a message of greetings to the second summit of heads of state and government of the African Union to open in Maputo.
 The message said that this summit would mark another important occasion of enhancing the function and role of the newly founded African union and increasing the joint efforts of the African countries to settle disputes, economic problems and other issues of the continent by themselves.    
 The message expressed belief that the summit would successfully discuss all the items on its agenda in conformity with the aspiration and desire of all the African people and achieve good results.

articles.title: DPRK business delegation leaves for Russia
articles.content:
Hong Song Nam greets Peruvian Prime Minister
    Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Hong Song Nam, Premier of the DPRK cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Beatriz Merino on his appointment as Prime Minister of Peru.
 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two peoples would grow stronger, the message sincerely wished him great success in the performance of his new duty.

    Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Rakwon General Bureau led by its director general Pak Kyu Hong left here today to visit the far eastern region of the Russian Federation.
